title: (6400-455) Pinhel - 6 Rua Silva Gouveia
description: It is a common and free car park near the historic center of Pinhel, where you can leave your van to visit the town: the castle, the cobbled streets, the wall, the churches... At least 8-9 6-meter spaces, although sloping. Nearby there is a tourist office and a public toilet.

title: (6400-337) Pinhel - 34 Avenida Gago Countinho
description:
Motorhome parking with all services and very well located. It has toilets, drinking water and a water disposal area.
Overnight allowed.
It is very close to the police, a cafeteria, a bakery and pastry shops.
It is also very close to a restaurant, swimming pools and a gym. Laundry at 200 meters.
It also has easy access.
Great for visiting the city.

title: (6400) Pinhel - Unnamed Road

title: (6440-031) Castelo Rodrigo - 44 Rua da Cadeia
description:
Brand new parking for motorhomes: 10 spaces.
Stuning view !
On the edge of a low traffic road.
Garbage cans, drinking water, and a little higher public toilets.

At the foot of Castello de Rodrigo.
Lower: a swimming pool (2.5€)
Higher up, two bars (3.5€ the Porto Tonic, to discover)

Congratulations to the city for this beautiful place!

title: (6440) Castelo Rodrigo - 3 Rua Sinagoga
description: Directly at the foot of the castle and the old town you will find this charming picknick area, also suitable for an overnight stay. Picknick tables are available, also water but not supposed to fill your motorhome. Just follow the road around the castle and you will automatically find the area. Castello Rodrigo is an old and charming place, in the new town you will find an Intermarché and everything you need. Peaceful and quiet, please keep it clean.

title: (6440-031) Figueira de Castelo Rodrigo - 12 Rua da Tapada
title_short: (6440-031) Figueira de Castelo Rodrigo - 12 Rua da Tapada
description: There are no services. The parking lot will be small, especially on days of increased outside influence. The house inside the castle is worth visiting (-2 hours). It is wonderful. The landscape is magnificent.

title: (5150) Santa Comba - Unnamed road
description: Car park at the southern entrance to the Faia Brava nature reserve. Along a road with almost no traffic. Flat land that can accommodate 2 to 3 vans. No service but direct access to the reserve where you can see golden eagles and various vultures. 2 easy routes, one of 2 km and the other of 10 km. Magnificent walks in the middle of nature where it is possible to see wild horses and cows.

title: () - N340

title: (6430) - Unnamed Road
description: Esplanade located a few meters back from the cruise (because this region is very exposed to the wind), you can see the castle and the city. Two kilometers from the center. Very calm district. The bells of sheep flocks when you walk. The visit to Marialva is essential. A charming village. A very kind older gentleman set up a chiringuito with a very cool terrace to rest and have a snack. The alleys are authentically medieval and flowery. The castle is in ruins but it is very large and contains the layout of old streets and houses. It is impressive to walk (carefully) on the wall bypassing it. We wish you as much pleasure as we do.

title: (6355) - A25

title: (6360) Lajeosa do Mondego - Unnamed Road
description:
Land under construction, great space to park in peace and quiet in contact with nature, in the town of Aldeia Rica, 5 minutes from the A25 and IP2, it has a river beach 2 km away where you can swim, fish or simply enjoy a day of leisure, it has paths for hiking as well as a football field 5 to 500m. It is located 8 minutes from the historic village of Celorico da Beira, where there are several monuments and castles, close to the service area.
Quiet place to be in contact with nature and its animals. The land has a well with water and in the future wells will be created to discharge waste water from the caravans.
Unit price per vehicle for 5 euros daily.

name: Quinta das Vinte Quelhas
title: (6300-025) Quinta das Vinte Quelhas
description: Great place to park your van overlooking the Mondego valley in the Serra da Estrela area, shaded by linden trees throughout the park area. Dry compost toilets available, possibility to shower and do laundry. Upon request, Miguel will cook a 4-course vegetarian menu. Possibility of cooking workshops or beekeeping. Water from a mountain spring, 6 donkeys and a goat available. Possibility of donkey hikes, river kayak rentals, paragliding tandems depending on the weather. Aldeias Históricas nearby, tons of mountain viewpoints, sky for bird watching, perfect for BTT downhill, lots of boulders to climb and climbing routes nearby. Possibility to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables from the farm. PS: remember that a fire engine has to drive through the hamlet. So if it can make it, so will your RV, unless it's a really gigantic vehicle. Mine is an old Mercedes 407D 7m long with 72hp and only 4 gears and it gets on the farm well! PPS: If you arrive and nobody is at the farm, just park your van, we might just be visiting bees or working on the top of the mountain. Call us!

title: (6360) Celorico da Beira - 34 Rua Maximiano António da Costa
title_short: (6360) Celorico da Beira - 34 Rua Maximiano António da Costa
description: Free parking space in the city center. About 500 m to the nearest supermarket. Supply, disposal and electricity available free of charge. Showers (currently 02/2022 cold) and toilets available. Accessibility for toilet and shower. Free WiFi throughout the city center!

The area has up to 10 parking spaces and an eco-sanitary service platform for these vehicles, Wi-Fi connection and 24-hour surveillance.

title: (3630) Antas -
description: We slept here one night, when you are on the main "main" road you have to take a small pebble path and the spot will be almost immediately on the left. Super quiet place. The view is superb

title: (6300) - EM556-1
description: Superb rest area above the body of water, path to the right before treatment unit, 50 m nice path.

title: (3630-018) Antas -
description: Superb spot to cool off, spend an afternoon or evening, even night in my opinion.

title: (6360) Celorico da Beira - Rua do Paco
title_short: (6360) Celorico da Beira - Rua do Paco
description: Picnic (= Parque de merendas) 50m away from N 16 road, on Vila Boa do Mondego village, with 5 tables+seats, grill and fresh water (tap with no thread 10m away from street).

title: (6300-270) Vila Soeiro - Eira de Fora
description: Picnic area in the village. To eat before doing the Passadiços do Mondego route. Super quiet, with picnic tables.

title: (5180) Freixo de Espada à Cinta -
description: Beautiful view border Portugal & Spain. Very quiet, beautiful sunset and sunrise. The road to it is easy to do with 7 campers.

title: (3640-180) Sarzeda - M582
description: Sarzeda village of Sernancelhe county, district of Viseu. Water fountain without thread (requiring hose about 3cm diameter). 500m away from N229 road.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa -
description: Miradouro da estrada da costa

title: (6300) - EM556
description: Good drinking water nearby the dam at Caldeirao lake , it's on the side of the road,  it's easy to miss it.

title: (37240) Lumbrales - Calle Rodera de Estornija
description: Old train station. Level parking with plenty of shade for 5 ac. Quiet place to spend the night

title: (6300) Trinta -
description: Quietly installed at the edge of the water, not disturbed at all. We spent 2 nights and we were able to enjoy swimming. Access is via a steep path, the ascent of which requires motor skills. Not recommended at CC

title: (3640-180) Sarzeda - 32 Rua Cieiro
description: Sarzeda village of Sernancelhe county, district of Viseu: water fountain on roundpoint of N 229 road. It has not thread, so requires hose about 3 cm diameter.

title: (3630) Penedono - N331
description: Free public P, asphalt but a little unleveled, near roundpoint and direct access from N 331 road (opposite side of municipal swimming pool), with memorial. At 908m high. Easy access (300m) to historic center of this medieval village with medieval small shaped nice castle; near it, tourist office and bar, restaurant and traditional shopping. Supermarket following street to right of P outlet.

title: (6360) Celorico da Beira -
description:
Campervan spot on a 28 hectare farm with stunning views over the Serra da Estrela. Eco toilet and outdoor solar (hot) shower available.

To reach our farm, follow the M553 from Celorico da Beira to Vide-entre-Vinhas and then continue the same road to Galisteu. Only at this point you can trust your GPS and make your descent to our farm via the last kilometer of dirtroad.

title: () Saucelle - DSA-590
description: Remote site near the river. Beware of the river when they open the floodgates of the dam. Very secluded and quiet. Access: exit "Central Saucelle II", then "Desagües". Nice sunset over the Douro.

title: (6370) Sobral Pichorro -
description: We only stopped for and ate something but this is a nice place for a night. Can be windy. Good internet/ 4G connection.

title: (5180) - N221
description: Magnificent point of view, where a few birds of prey evolve in total freedom, very calm. Possible to spend the night, no service.

title: (5155) Horta - N222
description: Free parking located in the center of the village. Accessible to all sizes, stabilized, level and close to some shops (Restaurant, bar), the place does not shine by its bucolic characteristics. No service but satellite reception and 4G optimal. Picnic tables available.

title: (6300) Maçainhas de Baixo - N338
description: It is about 10 years ago abandoned development area. The descent is in front of the bridge, 2nd exit on the left. Beautiful view of the lake and the valley. Approximately 50m to the lake, here is a great bathing facility. The place is very secluded and quiet.

title: (6300) - N338
description: Small nice place to spend a quiet night by a lake where you can swim. Accessible by a path engraved without any difficulties.

title: (6300) Corujeira - Estrada Caldeirão - Maçainhas
description: At the edge of a lake, in the shade of trees, quiet and pleasant place.

title: (6300) - N18
description: Small parking lot directly on the N18. Several trees provide shade. A small stream splashes down the slope under ferns. No facilities - please take your rubbish with you

title: (3640) Sernancelhe -
description: Place on top of a hill, with good views. Very quiet, the wind turbine makes a continuous noise, inside the vehicle it is not heard. Road suitable for all vehicles.

title: (37257) Saucelle - Unnamed Road / Belvédère du Salto
title_short: (37257) Saucelle - Unnamed Road / Belvédère du Salto
description: Parking flat and quiet at the top of the valley. Amazing views

title: (6320) - N324
description: An esplanade next to a small chapel unobstructed and very easy access to 200m from the spa. Quiet but without shadow. The spa is great and very affordable.

name: Parque de merendas de N Senhora de Ao Pé da Cruz.
title: (3640) Parque de merendas de N Senhora de Ao Pé da Cruz.
title_short: (3640) Parque de merendas de N Senhora de Ao Pé da Cruz.
description: Picnic space in the middle of nature on top of the hill, flat to overnight, crowned by chapel Nossa Senhora de Ao Pé da Cruz (875m). Good access besides slope; spaces under and out trees. Extended landscapes mainly towards NW (Sernancelhe small town and Vilar dam). Tranquility and peace. Advise about not remain longer than 12 h. Hike “Rota da Castanha e do Castanheiro”.

title: (3640) Sernancelhe - 18 Bairro do Sul Minheiro
description: Washing machine, service station, car wash and vacuum cleaner. Nearby there is a food shop, a bakery and a children's park.

title: (6320) Termas do Cró - N324
description: Hidden between the ruins of the old thermal baths is a fully functional Eurorelais with drinking water, toilet emptying and a gray water outlet. Parking and staying the night is more comfortable in the parking lot of the new thermal baths, just 100m away.

title: (6320) - N324
description: Big park next to and abandoned thermal ruin, and next to a modern hotel thermal spa. You can use the spa has an external, and still sleep in the van. Has a restaurant that you can go to in the hotel. We used the massage session to. Good place, with bike tracks. Good for 2 nights! No noice and very good sky at night.

title: (37230) Hinojosa de Duero -
description: Cachón de Camaces viewpoint

title: (3640) Sernancelhe - R. Colégio
description: Public free illuminated P, aside N 229 road and building “Exposalão - Pavilhão multiusos” as well as bus station. Supposed to be quiet to overnight because traffic remains reduced. Leveled places at bottom.

title: (3640-211) Sernancelhe - 37 Avenida Tílias
description: Small public free P aside sport ground, very near main and long Tílias Avenue, and firemen (= Bombeiros). Not compatible for motorhomes longer than camper vans (for longer vehicles, see another P in this small town).

title: (6300) - Rua do Fundo do Povo
description:
Clean drinking water - you have two options - one from the pipe( this one is dirty at this time, lack of usage? ) - second straight from the stream which comes up from nature( the access is easy ) 
also lots of wild nettles and  mint.
enjoy!!

title: (3640-219) Sernancelhe - 18 Largo Município
description: Square with old town hall on the middle, and other parking spaces on streets around, just in middle of this very old small city (XII century) still with several original granite buildings and pilori. Police (GNR) office very near. Also near long stairs to climb top of castle ruin hill. Maybe busy on working hours. NOTE about vehicle dimensions: difficult to > 2,5m and 7m long.

title: (6370) - Unnamed Road
description: Land next to the sanctuary. Different locations under trees pay attention to the height of the vehicles because of the low branches. Highest ride at Castro de Santiago with space available. No service.

title: (6360) - Unnamed Road
description: Ideal location near a small lake for quiet van insured

title: (6360) - N17
description: Parking at garage, very friendly host (Hugo). Restaurant adjacent..

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - N324
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - N324
description: Fill well with grid for canister without thread

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 10 IP2
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 10 IP2
description: Flat tarmac car park adjacent to the hydro baragem of the Douro river.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
description: Large paved parking lot next to a jetty on the Douro River. Quiet place to rest and spend the night. Without services.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
description: A calm and peaceful place on the banks of the Douro, possibility of swimming. Easy access to any vehicle.

title: (6300-245) Bairro da Ribeira - 61 Bairro do Ribeiro
title_short: (6300-245) Bairro da Ribeira - 61 Bairro do Ribeiro
description: Quite flat parking lot, very quiet, perfect to spend  the day

title: (5160) Rio Douro - IP2
description: Parking area next to old road/railway bridge. Nice views of the damn too. Bridge is an interesting walk but it says no pedistrians so definitely take care and be careful.

title: (3570) Aguiar da Beira - 11 Avenida da Liberdade
title_short: (3570) Aguiar da Beira - 11 Avenida da Liberdade
description: Public free P behind Câmara Municipal (= townhall), maybe busy on working hours, a little un leveled at bottom (no painted spaces), illuminated by night, quiet enough to overnight. Near traditional shops. Monuments and tourist office accessible easily by foot.

title: (6300) Videmonte - CM1176
description: Car park beginning of the Mondego catwalk route, a little inclined, quiet and safe, perfect for doing the catwalks

title: (5180) Freixo de Espada à Cinta -
description: Very quiet place at nearly the end of the road (just around the corner a chain indicates private property, although the road seems to continue). Great view on the lake, away from the crowds. No phone reception, however.

title: (37257) Saucelle - 44 Calle Camino Frejo
description: Parking along a little-traveled street, next to the municipal swimming pools where there are the usual services, with a bar and table area accessible without entering the pool.There is a route to the viewpoint of the Moor that leaves near here, nearby supermarket In the well supplied village, they are very nice. Nice town to see the Arribes.

title: (5155) - Rua das Flores
description: Ground parking allowing access to the ruin of the castle which is very nice to visit (in addition free access). The panorama is superb and could have spent the night there without problem. We also recommend the small town bar with a great welcome. Attention, difficult access road for large vehicle because the alleys of the city are narrow.

title: (3640) Vila da Ponte - 12 Marginal Távora
description: Free in line P along Marginal do Távora lane just aside Távora river left side, parallel to N 226 that follows at higher level. Alternative to P nearer beach on beginning of dam. Hike “Passadiço do Távora” starts 600m away.

title: (6320-261) - 9 Largo da Igreja
description: Special place for buses, larger campers not accessible !! Nice place to relax. There is a beach on a river of running spring water. There are toilet showers for men and women. There are barbecues and a tap at the tables.

title: (37240) Lumbrales - 51 Calle Camping
description: Plot at the foot of the road, next to an abandoned campsite, where you can park and spend the night, without services or artificial lighting, a very quiet place.

title: (3640) Vila da Ponte - 307 Rua Direita
description: Small parking lot where I often see campers.

title: (37257) Saucelle - 56 Calle Camino Frejo
description: Parking in the village of Saucelle, small and pretty village, parking with incredible views of the Arribes and the region of Portugal. At the gates of municipal pools, sports fields. 50 meters from the cafeteria sports facilities and children's games. Supermarket in the village, hiking trails. Source 50 meters in the street on the left.

name: Area de Serviço Autocaravanas
title: (5180-164) Area de Serviço Autocaravanas
description: Area in a closed park. Go through the gate with sliding door, go to the bottom of the park then to the left. Free services, electricity included.

title: (3570-043) Aguiar da Beira - 2 Rua Costeira
description: Small free P on old castle ruins hill (802m) near historic center and tourist office, little un leveled. Nice sunset from the P, and sunrise just opposite castle ruins slope. Street round this hill, with extended panorama day and night to E and S. Quiet overnight (illuminated); if windy, move to the other P suggestion.

title: (5150-501) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150-501) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
description:
PLEASE READ THE INTRODUCTION BEFORE CLAIMING ABOUT THINGS.

Beautiful and calm place to stay one night. There are public toilets (probably closed), a lot of little uneven shaded places to park, and an astonishing landscape to the Douro river. Near by you can find a fishing spot, a river beach without guard. You can also take a boat trip in "Embarcação Senhora da Veiga" on the other side of the dam just take a look in the website of the city council. I added this place because is in my hometown and I downloaded the photo from google just to show you the view from the chapel. Hope you enjoy it!

title: (3640) Vila da Ponte - 307 Rua Direita
description: Flat riverside free P (on line parking not painted, followed by transversal marked spaces), just aside riverside with beach (beginning of Vilar dam). Bar, picnic tables and children's games nearby, as well as restaurant. Pleasant surroundings (extended panorama from hill of Senhora das Necessidades chapel, 2 km away accessible to vehicles beside hard climbing up); walking path “Passadiço do Távora”.

title: () Saucelle - Camino del Picón y de los Lagares
title_short: () Saucelle - Camino del Picón y de los Lagares
description: A beautiful flat spot for about 3 campers or 4 vans. A little further than the already indicated spots in the area. A little more remote. We had a wonderful swim here and were not disturbed by anyone. You have to go over a piece of dirt road but it is doable!

address.street: Camino del Picón y de los Lagares

title: (3640) Vila da Ponte -
description: Newly created parking lot, little un leveled and gravel soil. Only for self-sufficient vehicles! Wonderful new 3 km long walking trail (“Passadiço do Távora”) on wood along the shore of Vilar dam. Modern pedestrian bridge! 2 small restaurants in the village and bridge to N 226 road. Don’t miss visit ver old small city SERNANCELHE, 4 km away.

title: (37240) Lumbrales - Unnamed Road
description: Parking from which you can access by a path to Castro Veton "Las Merchanas". The car park is reached by a compacted dirt track about 3 km from the town of Lumbrares. Fairly level.

title: (5130) Pereiros -
description: Natural area just before the Nossa sanctuary. Splendid view, access to vans.

title: (5155) Custóias - Unnamed Road
description: Chapel at the top of the mountain, extraordinary view. Place arranged for the local festivals but deserted the evening of our coming.

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Praia Fluvial de Congide (River beach). Very calm. Swimming pool, water, swimming, avoid weekends. 3/4 places on the track at the bottom.

title: (6300) - N18-1
description: Quiet place to spend a night with superb views of the Serra de Estrela range. At the foot of the wind farm ... Nice mist in the morning but a little cool wind!

title: (5180-133) Freixo de Espada à Cinta - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5180-133) Freixo de Espada à Cinta - Unnamed Road
description: Great place for day parking, near a beautiful river beach. Water and toilets around.

title: (37497) Carpio de Azaba - 19 Calle Sol
description: Public fountain, the flow is not very large. You can stand practically next to it.

title: (5180) Freixo de Espada à Cinta - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5180) Freixo de Espada à Cinta - Unnamed Road
description: Viewpoint on the way to the river beach of Congida. Nice views and place to eat. No shade, no services. It is worth stopping and taking in the views.

title: (6360-103) Mesquitela - 12 Rua da Ponte
description: Very quiet place, with plenty of drinking water

title: (6370) Ponte de Juncais - N330
description: Beautiful idyllic meadow high above the river. Gravel path leads off from river beach nearby. Is feasible for smaller WoMos (5-6m). When there is a lot of rain, the river can flood and flood the path.

title: (6370) Fornos de Algodres - 7 N16
description: Beautiful place located just right riverside of Mondego at picnic areas. Camper length up to 10 m (may be difficult to reverse). Swimming possible (surveillance on Summer). Beautifully situated on a river. Toilets and bar available in Summer.

title: (6370) - 7 N16
description: Along the river. Very large parking, even heavy goods vehicles can pausing. Peaceful place. Very good for so bathed!

title: (6290) Linhares da Beira -
description: Linhares da Beira Castle Square. Approximately 7 places for cars and vans right in front of the castle. The climb that does not pass through the town is very steep and narrow. There is a small shady park with benches right next door, and also WC in the village. Access to the 12th century castle is free. The town is very small and quiet.

title: (5180) Freixo de Espada à Cinta -
description: 380° view stone picnic tables and benches in absolute calm shade drinking water tap very spacious parking possible almost flat, 4 G, partial view of the Douro.

title: (3640-120) Freixinho - Unnamed Road
description: Leisure stone paved lane with trees along Vilar dam aside Freixinho village. Illuminated at night. Very peaceful besides near village. Take care with GPS access; follow “Zona de lazer” panel on main road/street.

title: (5180-160) Freixo de Espada - 221 N221
description: On the heights of Freixos de Espeda in Cinta, in the forest...several possibilities of pitches...very calm and beautiful view...for one night it's cool.

title: (6370) - Ponte de Juncais, N 330 km 30,1.
(5160) Torre de Moncorvo - IP2
description: Nice parking spot next to a big lake with small mountains. Beautiful scenery! A bay next to the road. During day you hear cars, at night quiet. Great for a stop over rest.

title: (6360) - Rua Brandão de Melo
description: Simple parking to visit the medieval village on rocks and its castle. Very quiet in the middle of the day, so for one night. ...

title: (5160) Torre de Moncorvo - Unnamed Road
description: Point of view with bins a little higher. Possibility of parking but on holds. Magnificent view. Thank you for respecting the places! Miradouro Santa Leocádia

title: (5160) - Rua da Romanzeira
description: Beautiful quiet place on top of a hill next to a church with a view of Moncorvo. There are toilets for which you can ask the keys at the tourist office, and there are bbqs to use, with shelter and tables.

title: (3640) Fonte Arcada - Miradouro da Senhora da Saúde
title_short: (3640) Fonte Arcada - Miradouro da Senhora da Saúde
description: Great spot at flat hill of “Miradouro de Nossa Senhora da Saúde”, with amazing views towards W across the Albufeira de Vilar (dam) and the hills beyond, as well as Fonte Arcada village just below; also nice sunset. Very quiet to overnight.

title: (6300) - EM619
description: Place in the countryside, in a steep path ... very isolated, but I get the 4g ... I can surf the internet .... for info I come from Guarda, where I could find gas bottles camping gas 907 for my T4, close to Decathlon ...

title: (5160) - N102
description: At the edge of the Douro, 2 boats at the dock, in front of the beach, quiet and shaded area for a van or 2. no services but shower and toilet on the beach 5 min.

title: (6320) ALDEIA DEL PONTE - 4 Rua do Ribeiro
title_short: (6320) ALDEIA DEL PONTE - 4 Rua do Ribeiro
description: Free area near a small pond; P limited to 48 h. About 150 m W there is picnic area (4 + 3 large granite tables+seats) just aside very old bridge (= ponte) that gave name to village.

title: (6290-071) - 165 Rua da Fonte
description: Small place to park and stay one day or one night. There are 8 parking spaces and a sports hall in front where there are showers and water.

title: (5160) - N102
description: Comfortable rest area with flat parking, picnic tables and even sinks and WC barbecue area => ideal for one night.

title: () - E802
description: Quiet corner at the edge of the Douro possibility of water, toilet, small restaurant where you eat cheap fish fry caught in the Douro, not easy to find but it deserves! Foz Do Sabor Village
